intro: Oxytropis suprajenissejensis, commonly known as the Altai locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often trifoliate, with small, rounded leaflets. Oxytropis suprajenissejensis is also known for its toxic alkaloids, which can affect livestock if ingested.
